definition: to conclude a treaty/to make an agreement/contract (at bridge)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: He has to draw spades first in order to make the contract.
sentences.chinese: 爲了完成定約墩數，他得先吊黑桃。

sentences.english: Five no-trump asked North to pick a slam.
sentences.chinese: 5NT是讓北家選擇一個滿貫定約。

sentences.english: Modern bridge known as contract bridge.
sentences.chinese: 現代橋牌稱爲定約橋牌。

sentences.english: Only perfect defense could set four spades.
sentences.chinese: 只有出色的防守才能打宕四黑桃的定約。

sentences.english: You're a contractor in this part of the agreement, remember that.
sentences.chinese: 你是這部分協議的定約人，記住這一點哦。

sentences.english: The player who first named the suit (or no-trump) is the declarer.
sentences.chinese: 最先叫出最後定約花色或無將的牌手爲莊家。

sentences.english: We set them two tricks at four spades.
sentences.chinese: 我們使他們的四黑桃定約宕了兩墩。

sentences.english: It 's correct to take the safest play for the contract AT rubber bridge .
sentences.chinese: 在盤式橋牌中，用最保險的打法完成定約是正確的。

sentences.english: We set them two tricks at four spades.
sentences.chinese: 只有出色的防守才能打宕四黑桃的定約。
